request_pathways.name: Authorization to Use or Disclose Health Information
Fax to HIM Release of Information Office
Mail to WellSpan Health HIM, 50 Wyntre Brooke Drive, York, PA 17403

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients download a generic system-wide HIPAA authorization form, select 'Personal' as the purpose, and submit via fax, email, or mail to the HIM office.

red_flags: Requests last 4 digits of SSN, which is unnecessary for patient identification and introduces privacy risk on a faxed/mailed form
bright_spots: Secure portal email delivery option with 30-day PDF availability
Explicit right-to-self language: patient's right to have records released directly to them for review
Copies accepted in lieu of original form
Immediately discoverable via web search with no access barriers

findability.rationale: Level 5: Prominently available with minimal effort — form was immediately discoverable via straightforward web search with direct PDF link, no login walls or bot blocking.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Usable digitally with workarounds — born-digital PDF has a text layer but zero fillable fields, requiring print-and-handwrite completion; fax and email submission are available.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity issues — logical 2-page layout with clear sections and good record-type granularity, but the sensitive-records paragraph is dense and the witness requirement is ambiguous.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the form is a generic third-party authorization with 'Obtain from'/'Disclose to' structure; patients must adapt it for self-access, though the 'Personal' checkbox and explicit right-to-self language help.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding — SSN collection is unnecessary but limited to last 4 digits; fee amounts are unspecified but referenced as regulated; treatment non-conditioning and revocation rights are clearly stated.

overall.summary: WellSpan York Hospital provides an easily findable, reasonably well-designed authorization form with modern delivery options and explicit right-to-self language, but the lack of fillable fields and generic third-party form structure limit the digital and patient-centered experience.
